dt: {bc}an oscillation in the apparent aspect of a secondary body (such as a planet or a satellite) as seen from the primary object around which it revolves

et: Latin {it}libration-, libratio{/it}, from {it}librare{/it} to balance, from {it}libra{/it} scales
shortdef: an oscillation in the apparent aspect of a secondary body (such as a planet or a satellite) as seen from the primary object around which it revolves
